Name: TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards
Description:
TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards is a Non-Standard Universal Deck based on the principles of yin and yang. This deck can be used to play over 15 games.

TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards are an improved version of the standard deck. The power behind this deck is in its versatility to be interpreted in multiple ways creating different core game mechanics.

There are four main game styles: 
1)TAIJI - Uses + & - Card Values. Winning hands are closest to zero. (Use absolute value to determine winner)
2)WUJI - Uses + & - Card Values. Winning hands are farthest from zero. (Use direct correlation to determine winner)
3)CLASSIC - All Card Values are positive. Interpret cards like a standard deck with predetermined Card Hierarchy.
4)INTERPRETIVE - Rules unique for individual games.

The numerous game styles allow for a wide variety of card games to be played, with the manufacturer currently publishing rules for 15 unique games on their website.

Name: Forward Operations
Description:
In Forward Operations, two to four players control border nations rushing to build and man forward operating bases so they can take and hold critical objectives in a neighboring country that is becoming unstable. Win the game by holding those objectives for victory points or by destroying the Command Center of your opponents' bases.

Players start with an established forward operating base, which consists of a Command Center, Barracks and a Power Plant. During the game, you'll play Command Cards to generate resources, which can be used to expand your base, develop new technologies, train or manufacture military units, and wage war on your opponents in bloody, fast-paced combat.

Forward Operations is a turn-based wargame sandbox filled with interesting player decisions and building options. Choose between 14 different buildings to expand your base and 25 different military units to build a personalized army that suits your strategy and playing style. Time and resources are limited, so choose wisely.

See you on the battlefield.

—description from the designer

Name: Homo
Description:
Players each control 12 round, triangle, and square pieces that can move diagonally and orthogonally, diagonally, and orthogonally respectively. Capturing is done by sandwiching an opponent's piece between two of the same pieces. The winner is the player who captures all of his opponent's pieces. A player loses if he cannot move or no longer have two pieces of the same shape.

—user summary

Name: Zig Zag
Description: Players take turns placing black or white pieces on a 8x14 grid to connect both sides of the board. Only bicolored pieces can be placed on the black squares, and these can be turned over into the opponent's color when surrounded by the opponent's pieces.

Name: High Heavens: Minotaur
Description: The Minotaur is a limited edition playable character for High Heavens. With his unique special ability, the Minotaur can clear the way for other gods by damaging multiple adjacent enemies in one attack. This was a promo created for the PAX Unplugged booth.

Name: Palabrerío
Description:
A creative game to find the best words.
Like tutti frutti game, but with five different ways to play it!

Five forms of play: "everyone plays", "challenge", "just drawings", "go ahead" and "say it with mimicry". Each with a different score. We just have to find the best words. Highly competitive!

Name: Poesía a la Carta: María Teresa Andruetto
Description:
A poetic game to connect with the poetry of María Teresa Andruetto.

Three forms of play: "poetry on demand", "poetic tarot" and "recycling of words". Think of a question and poetry will answer you. Includes 5 Tarot figures and 5 quotes chosen by the author.

Name: Poesía a la Carta: Gustavo Roldán
Description:
A game to connect with the poetry of Gustavo Roldán.
As a poetic oracle, each poem, combined with the lunfardo, can offer us an answer.

Three forms of play: "poetry on demand", "poetic oracle" and "playing the game". Think of a question and poetry will answer you. Includes 10 letters with words from the lunfardo to complete the answer.

Name: Poesía a la Carta: Laura Devetach
Description:
A poetic game to connect with the poetry of Laura Devetach.

Three forms of play: "poetry on demand", "poetic oracle" and "cauldron of questions". Think of a question and poetry will answer you. Include 10 hexagrams from the I-Ching to complete the answer.

Name: Contame: Inicios
Description:
You can choose beginnings, settings, objects and characters to create the best stories.
Ideal for collaborative play.

Players must separate the deck into 3 groups: "beginnings", "scenarios" and "illustrations". Whoever starts chooses a card from the “beginnings” deck and one from the “scenarios” deck to begin and set the story. Then it will take 5 "illustrations". With all these cards you must create and tell a new story.
